S_L0cNkuRelJGHTjIgJ2qg.text: It's been about 3 years since I was last here (I think) but after I ordered my starter (ravioli) I remembered I'd had that before, and it was as tasty as I remembered it. They give you a complementary fish cake while you wait, and the food is really good. I opted for whole lobster salad as a main and it didn't disappoint. The only things I would change is having proper pepper mills on the table, and not to put the brown edged salad on the plates but other than that, the service was good, and to be offered a free hot chocolate while I waited to pay the bill was a really lovely touch.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Very nice hot chocolate. Free, to warm me up before the long journey back to the hotel (50 yards) not complaining :-)
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Lobster claws.

41YuTOFAegGYzK-7xWVa7A.text: Been to this plaice (get it? Yeah, I know) many times before and always have good food. As a pescatarian this place should be ideal for me, but not so. Unfortunately they deep fry all the battered fish, fish cakes and chips in the same oil that they use for meat so I can't eat any of that, so the options are limited, but if you are not bothered by this sort of thing then get your laughing gear round this place and tuck in. Service was lacking this time and there was some confusion between order and table, but this is the first time this has happened in all of my visits. Definitely try the apple pie :)

x8u1PB8b74flI8TyOLVR4w.text: Fish and chips is one of those things that some people think is all the same but, No, it's not, at all.The location, on a 1960s council estate shopping precinct a few minutes south of Angel means that it's not about a hipster, trendoid place of the moment but it is all about good food and for me that's what I want.There's a full seafood restaurant which looks great and look forward to visiting next time but this visit was take away fish and chips. There's a separate take away counter on the side with a separate entrance which overlooks the restaurant kitchen so you can see the action. Our fish was freshly fried from what looked like diagonally cut thick sections of cod as we watched them being dipped in batter.The guys working the fryers were clearly at the top of their game and gave us some mini fish cake bites to snack on while we hungrily waited which were much appreciated.On eating: the batter was crisp, tasty and light and the encapsulated cod was perfectly cooked (fresh, snow white, steaming, tender flakes). The chips were great too. Just right.Portion size: generous as it should be.Mushy peas were the proper kind, not the crushed garden peas that some other places are dishing up....and the price was right.

UWNpFMQ5w4qiIpsYd6rlaQ.text: Fantastic meal from start to finish.Everything comes together here. The food is wonderful and the value is very good. The staff was very attentive, friendly. One thing I loved was that it didn't matter which server we asked, they always helped us out (I've been to many places where if you ask a server who is not your own, they respond with, "Let me get your server." That always annoys me.). The place itself is clean and fairly modern.The whole time we were here we got the impression that the staff really wanted to ensure we had a great meal - and we did. Highly recommended.

tv3IUhIbsV1F8gYjzs1NnQ.text: Probably the nicest restaurant in England situated in the courtyard of a council estate, though having spent minimal time in council estate courtyards I couldn't be sure.I ordered a haddock and chips.  Fish was excellent, perfectly firm with a crispy batter of good flavour (seeing as the batter is, at least, 50% of the allure of fried fish it must rest on it's own laurels, rather than act as a mere crispy blanket for the fish).Chips were less good; not crispy, oily and some undercooked.  The complimentary fish cakes were really delicious, though I'd probably refer to them as potato croquettes with a bit of fish inside.Service was very efficient and the staff were lovely.I didn't feel very healthy after the meal, but rock'n'fucking'roll.

Ww3r3HYcT4ymaluOi1tfxw.text: Love this spot. Best fish n chips I've ever had. I always swing by this place when I visit london. Can't really speak for any of the other dishes but the fish and chips.

2-Xzy3XiCQEfcQqDrTmziA.text: Saturday around 1 pm we had reservations for 4. We definitely did not need reservations for lunch time as there were only a few other tables full. The restaurant is mostly white - white walls, white table clothes, servers dressed in white and has an open feeling. But it's not fancy, it's a bit dated actually. Very simple and could probably use a bit of a modernization.We were seating at a round table next to the window and given very long paper menus. There are tons of fish choices and you can have them prepared however you'd like - deep fried, grilled, or coated in matzo meal. We choice four different fish - Haddock, Halibut, Hake, and the Roasted Cod with Mediterranean vegetables. The Haddock and Roasted Cod were from their daily menu, but the Halibut and hake were specials. Most dishes from their every day menu are served without sides - you must order them in addition. The Roasted Cod came with vegetables and that was clearly stated on the menu. The specials sometimes include sides and sometimes don't. The Halibut was served as is, but the Hake included chips.We ordered all four grilled and I love that they are prepared very simply. No seasonings or spices. Just fish. We also ordered the arugula, tomato, and parmeasan salad as well as the tomato and onion salad. One of the dishes came with chips and another dish came with veggies, so we had four sides in total.The Haddock and the Hake were quite similar to one another. The Hake was a bit more flavorful in my opinion and also softer - almost mushy, but in a good way. It was my favourite. The Haddock was probably my second favorite - it's a very safe fish, not much flavor, so quite a good choice if anyone is skeptical of eating fish. The Halibut was a huge portion (and I say this as someone who thinks portions are always too small). One person would honestly have a difficult time finishing it, but then again it was a pricier dish. We had to fillet it ourselves, but it was really very easy to do. It came out in one piece and there were no strays little pieces. I wasn't crazy about the Halibut and I think that's largely because it was a bit overcooked, which is quite a big faux pas. This is a fish restaurant! You cannot mess up in the cooking of your fish. The texture was quite firm and chewy, but the person who ordered it said it was his favorite of the four, so it worked out well. The Roasted Cod was hard to judge because it was cooked with Mediterranean vegetables and heavily flavored. I didn't love the flavor of the spices, but others did. It actually turned out that The person who ordered the cod liked it the best, the person who ordered the Halibut liked that the best, and I happened to like the Hake more than the Haddock and the Hake recipient liked the Haddock more, so we switched. It was perfect and I would highly highly recommend ordering different fish if you're going with a group of people. One of the best parts is getting to try several different fish all at once so you can really taste the difference in flavor and texture with fish.The sides were nothing to write home about. The tomato and onion salad was a large plate of just tomato and red onion. The arugula salad was just a pile of arugula with tomatoes and parmesan slices on top. The chips were mediocre. But I still love the concept of the restaurant, the variety in both fish choices and preparations, and I would definitely recommend it overall.We were also given complimentary salmon cakes (no one could taste the salmon and we actually had to confirm that we heard correctly that it was a salmon cake). Good, though.Service was very good - everyone was friendly, attentive, and answered questions patiently.

wV_K5EE9bgJuLByFxXpYvg.text: I went here with a tour group and it was great. They gave us great service and the food was good. It's a nice environment and it's really laid back. I had the fish and chips and it was very good. My family had the steaks and they throughly enjoyed them. I would definitely  recommend this place if you are near it.

rjrId_iuYtWj4gNEDFG7tw.text: We were looking for a fresh seafood fix and looked up this place close by.  When we arrived, the service was very warm and friendly.  The acoustics aren't great so it was a little loud.  I wouldn't recommend it for a quiet romantic evening, but there did seem to be a lot of larger tables with families or friends to which it was well suited.   We shared the sea bass special for our main, along with the squid, scallops, and a Greek salad.  Portions were generous and everything was cooked perfectly.  Usually, restaurant food is too salty for me, so it's funny for me to say, but I feel that our food could have used just a bit more salt.  But, this was easily remedied with some salt on the table. And finally, the bill wasn't too bad!  It's definitely one of the better value spots we've been to in London.  We'll be back again!

F8oQagZAMiGy5lXv75P0LA.text: Very good and reasonable prices.  I had the roasted cod over mediterranean veggies and it was excellent.  Service was spot on as well.

q0qGRTnJODZebVtJhG2yoQ.text: The service is super attentive, the oysters fab. The specials are good value and portions are large. Love it!

KJzzcHnxd00kdTyM3vsoqg.text: We just had a delightful lunch. The pan fried scallops on the starter list were to die for! The battered fried fish was the best I have ever had. They go to market several times a week and purchase the whole fish then bring it back and filet it themselves.  Of course, you can get it prepared any way you prefer. Everything we ordered was delicious and beautifully presented. The restaurant is extremely clean, staff very attentive, and it was a wonderful ecperience.

SfCDAeGsg-_m3Rqm2SKeRg.text: I do not say this lightly, but we may have taken the first step toward getting over our Royal (defunct pub in Wales) fixation.  Spot on fried fish in all its glorious permutations: hake, haddock, plaice, cod, etc.  Fries were also excellent.  Service was friendly and speedy.  Luckily the prices were extremely reasonable, so they offset the cost of the taxi.

TTbFisM18jS_5rM9WwkHSw.text: Fantastic place. Enjoyed my grilled John Dory special and snuck a bit of mum's sole. Really well prepared - definitely not a regular fish & chip! Also the prices are a bargain for London.

hQLvWQ5fUeVWrZb3WoXFJg.text: To finnish my current set of reviews after my visit to London I went to this busy and great no frills restaurant.It is terrific and great value. The mussels and cod are the best I have had in many a year and the service fast and unfussy. Well superb.

Qx2IIY2Z4AgBwNApZXrY3Q.text: Dinner here last was wonderful!  I am so happy to have found such a delicious, affordable, and easily accessible seafood restaurant.  It is a bit out of the way, but worth going if you are in the area.Fish central's menu has starters, main course fishes cooked in one of three ways (deep fried, grilled, and with mazo meal, I believe), and a number of side dishes to have with the fish.  There are meat dishes as well, but no one in our group ordered one and I cannot attest to it.We ordered 2 starters to share: mussels and baby octopus (which was one of the specials of the day).  The mussels were a yummy mess and we thankfully used the wet towel provided to wash our hands.  For main courses we ordered the cod with chips.  Huge pieces of cod, plenty of chips, and over all very good.I'd recommend making reservations beforehand.  When we arrived the first thing the host asked was whether we had reservations (we did not).  We waited about 15 minutes for a table which wasn't too long for a Saturday night, but for a party of 4 or more I imagine the wait would have been longer as this is not a large restaurant.Finally,  a note on the staff--so courteous and professional!  Truly excellent service and on a caliber in which I have not experienced in many London restaurants.

uzcbQhBjHIgB8hvFUCkCLQ.text: Set right amongst sets of estate buildings not far from City Road, Angel, you wouldn't have guessed you'd find this place. But if you live near by, it's well worth popping into. It is filled with a great mix of people from the residents of  the estates to business people in their suits. Fish Central first opened in 1968 as a local chippie but has since expanded and turned itself into a rather stylish, yet totally unpretentious place. It is set in a bungalow type building. The decor is plain, simple and clean, and the fish is fresh and wholesome. Definitely stick to the fish dishes if you can as that is what they do best there.  The typical fish and chips option is always a safe bet. A choice of fish (cod, haddock, plaice) can be done deep fried, grilled or as a matzo meal order a side of chips and mushy peas to top it all off. The desserts they have are very English, and very nice too.

48Q9Z25CUdWxhF3xEahFew.text: The fish and chips were great at reasonable prices. If we didn't know about this place from locals we would have never discovered it. Tucked away in a neighborhood atmosphere. Don't be discouraged by the appearance and area, great food!

dunbkW8E0jijEymxXYyDiw.text: Fish Central lives on the corner of a square near Old Street. At 9PM, it was one of the only places open on that square, and seemed like a magnet for people. Maybe they were drawn to it by the overwhelming smell of fish that you notice ten yards away on the street. The waitors all had senses of humour. When I asked if my Haddock would come with anything, the answer, by the waitor with a thick Italian accent which made it all the more surprising, was a deadpan, 'Yes. With the plate'.And that is where I take a star off (that, and the fear of the stink). It was slightly pricey for the amount of food you get if you are a struggling artist type. The cheapest main course was 7.95, but doesn't come with anything, so of course you have to order sides, which are between £1.50 and £3, which means that without ordering any drinks, the minimum amount you will spend is £10. Not very expensive according to some, a bit pricey for fish and chips. However, very yummy fish (the batter was excellent), pretty good mushy peas, and good chips. You can order all sorts of different kinds of fish, done in many different ways (my friend had black bream, not fried, which was outstanding) but if it's not cod or haddock, the prices for a main go up to £10-£14. The fish is very fresh, and probably worth it if you like fish. Which you would if you went to a place called Fish Central. They had two dishes for non-fish people, but seriously, what would be the point?They offered us a starter on the house, salmon fishcakes, which were delicious. I found a bone in mine. Proof that it is made of an actual fish.

pyRf68tbVTglnPtq_2xJQQ.text: LOVED IT!Highly suggest fish and chips.Don't let the "poshness" of this place fool you! They're super friendly and great service. Fried food usually irritates my stomach and this didn't at all. Very enjoyable!

Fo3tHFTiVmbLDPhQ9EV6EQ.text: Honestly a massive disappointment. I looked around on Yelp and this place seemed close by and well rated, but everything was disappointing.My friend and I asked for suggestions and were suggested the Lobster Spaghetti and the Dover Sole. We then added the Ravioli starter.The Ravioli starter was flavorless. Felt like eating a ball of pasta with nothing in it.The Lobster Spaghetti was literally a pound office pasta with a few heirloom tomatoes and a few very small pieces of lobster.The Dover Sole was a nice piece of fish, but ultimately lacked flavor. It's like they forgot how to use sauce or seasoning.The Chips were bland as sin, and lacked any quality texture or flavor.Service was also ridiculously slow. After completing our meal and taking our plates, it was a challenge to flag a waiter to actually get us the check.Overall, just a lackluster experience. The food wasn't awful, just aggressively mediocre. But I would actively avoid the place if you're looking for good food, especially at this price point.

OUpW61DgElKNlId0cvH6Fw.text: If you want a variety of fresh seafood in heaping portions for very reasonable prices, look no more. FC has been around for decades and its pride and genuine hospitality are evidence to why it continues to draw crowds. We arrived without a reservation around 9pm Saturday night and were fortunate to snag an open table for 3 in the way back. While it wasn't a great spot (near a staff entrance), service wasn't lacking and we had water, wine and starters within 15 minutes. The oysters are divine - enormous, well cleaned and unctuous. Half a dozen would have been plenty! The seafood pasta was a mountain of shellfish and carbs - I just barely got through 3/4 of it. My husband had the salmon main as well as the liver and bacon entree and thought both were finger licking good! I docked a star bc they forgot our order of fish soup which I have no doubt is delicious but we left full and satisfied so we'll be sure to order it on our next visit.

wefd2D389J8LPHtYYvcOpQ.text: The best first: the service was very friendly. But almost everything else was frustrating. The fish was very fresh and of good quality, but all the dishes were virtually unseasoned and to my taste much too bland. One side order for my mother never arrived, even after we reminded the staff of it.Later the restaurant became as crowded and noisy as a pub, which some might view as a feature, but was not what I had in mind for the evening. Last but not least it took at least 15 minutes after we had finished before we were given a chance to pay.

mVRrDIOEpkN9gBL-Ac8QRw.text: Fish Central started as a neighbourhood fish and chip restaurant in 1968 and it has slowly built up its reputation to be reknowned for its fish and chip. I personally don't agree but they're definitely one of the best for their other seafood dishes.It's atmosphere is bright and jolly with great energy from the staff. Customers are mainly locals but tourists are also making its way here now. A queue started to form shortly.Seafood are all very fresh, with new seafood in frequently to create a special menu for both starters and mains.Salmon fishcakes Lovely complimentary fishcakes to start. They were freshly made, incredibly light and fluffy inside making the thin crispy batter almost collapsing onto itself as soon as you bite into it. The filling was mostly mashed potatoes with bits of salmon but packed full of flavours from the addition of herbs and greens. Served with pickled cucumbers for that nice zest to it.West Mersea oysters Incredibly fresh oysters served with vinegar, Tabasco and lemon slices. The only complaints was that they weren't washed thoroughly so still had sand in some of them. Howeverthey were lovely and plump offering a clean aftertaste.Pan fried scallops Another dish where freshest and quality plays a huge part in making this so delicious. They were incredibly bouncy and sweet even without dipping it into the salsa verda. Although the latter helped add a lovely layer of herby flavour. A very generous portion for £7.45Plain grilled Scottish lobster with chipsA choice of Canadian or Scottish lobster and we chose the latter. Even being plain grilled the freshest of the lobster gave it that intense sweetness. A side of garlic butter and spicy sauce to help add addition flavour. The meat was very springy, coming straight off from its shell. Utensils given to crack open its claw to pick out the rest of the meat.SardinesSimple chargrilled sardines served with tomato and onion salsa. These almost flaked away in my mouth and although an oily fish the fishiness was very mild and more sweet due to the freshness. Chargrilled perfectly so the skin just crisp but the interior remained juicy. A lovely salsa to add a lovely contrast crunch to the textureHot oak smoked salmon saladSo thankful to the waiter who recommended this dish as it was phenomenal, especially for salmon which rarely wows me anymore. The salmon although smoked, remained moist. The strong sweetness from the honey contrasted with the savoury and spicy in the salmon marinate really gets the tastebuds going. Mixed with a lovely contrast of textures from the salad. Deep fried cod fish & rock salmonAs fresh as the fish was I was not a big fan of the hard crusted thick batter which soaked up a lot of oil. However it was crisp rather than dense so was easy to break through. The fish also came unseasoned so constantly needed salt to be added to give flavour throughout. Luckily both the fishes shone on it's own as they were so fresh their natural sweetness prevailed, with cod being more delicate in taste and plumpier in texture and  rock salmon sweeter in taste and more moist in texture.Rocket and tomato salad (with Parmesan)Something green, simple and light as a palate cleanser before we move onto the next dish. All very fresh with the tomatoes and lovely rich Parmesan there to give the dish umami.Whole grilled dover sole An incredibly meaty fish, meat densely packed but incredibly bouncy and delicately sweet in flavour. Perfectly grilled keeping all the moisture intact and the bone just came off the meat showing how fresh it was too. Probably my favourite fish out the mains.Grilled wing of skateForking through the gaps of the bone to take off the meat off the bone, all done effortlessly. Each strand was incredibly tender and springy, delicate in flavour although could have done with more salt to lift its flavour. The capers help add a contrast of sourness and beurre noisette giving it a nice buttery coating.Chips were the most disappointing part of the meal, very uninspiring, bland and limp. They needed to be fried longer allowing the skin to crisp and seasoned to give flavour to the potato.Creamed potatoes were much more successful, seasoned and with the addition of herbs to give it flavour. Could have been creamed further with the help of water as it was slightly too thick and heavy.I rarely get to eat such fresh seafood in London without paying an extortionate price for it. For freshness along and one was able to cook and retain all the moisture and sweetness in the seafood, I'm so impressed it has even become my favourite seafood restaurant. However their batter used for their fish and chips was disappointing, far to thick and heavy. There's definitely a lot more better for fish and chips like Kerbisher & Malt, offering a lighter crispier batter.But nothing can beat this lively Mediterranean atmosphere, low prices and the fact it is a homely local restaurant running for 48 years.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Tomato and rocket salad (with Parmesan)
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Chips
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Hot smoked oak salmon with honey mustard dressing

LRhnui2rxTAX3Vefpyjy-Q.text: Pretty good! I really enjoyed it here! I got the cod and chips (remember to order chips because everything is a la carte) and it was pretty good and only £9.90! I loved that even though the fries were kind of light in color they still had a good crunch. The fish batter was nice and crunchy but could have used alittle more seasoning. As weird as it sounds, this was probably the best tartare sauce I've ever had. Lmao. Anyway, definitely worth the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Cod and Chips for 9.90

FjD8o4yfNLYanI3YF-W04g.text: Gosh I am so full!The restaurant got very busy by 8. The food was so good.I went for the fish supper. A prawn cocktail starter then a cod or haddock with chips. Choose a Dessert from the menu. I had the special of the day - which was chocolate brownie with ice cream. Only downside was dessert would've been nice with a bit of chocolate sauce. Was a tad dry. I found this place using yelp otherwise wouldn't have known about it. They had lots of specials of the day to choose from too.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate brownie with ice cream
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Prawn cocktail

lN_3YXtXxk7aZma8-g45tw.text: Fish oasis near the City.Mediterranean flair without the price tag.Roast cod and Mediterranean vegetables 13+gbp only.Fish soup and appetizers also very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. fish soup not cream based
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. sardines appetizer
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. roast cod and med vegs

jPmGLgwBm3rktC74wQscTg.text: If you're local, you gotta make a stop here. Food is excellent, servings are HUGE, just an all around nailed it kind of experience. I got the mussels (appetizer was big enough for a family!), Matza meal halibut, mushy peas and sticky toffee. Meal would have cost double in the states; service and quality were top notch. There's nothing else to say but make it happen!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee, you won't get that in the states
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Matza meal halibut
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Menu

-DoSeWyusojqlVBT58kPBQ.text: I was really hungry and this restaurant is right across from my hotel so I decided to give it a try.  The food is very reasonably priced for London and the space is very nice.  I ordered the scallops for my appetizer and the roasted cod with vegetables as my entree.  All of the seafood tasted really fresh and perfectly cooked.  The appetizer and entree were generously sized and I was stuffed after finishing both.  My only complaint is that the dishes needed a bit of extra salt which is an easy fix since there's a salt shaker at the table.  I would definitely come back and try the fish and chips next time since that is their specialty.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Seared scallops with basil oil
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Roasted cod with Mediterranean vegetables

N13YrM7xc_GFe-1q_eJU0g.text: Loved the staff, not so much the food.5 stars for the friendly staff. Everyone was super nice and welcoming.The food did not impress. Had the fish and chips supper which was 13 pounds for three courses. They give a complimentary fried salmon ball, which was not bad - crispy on the outside, but the filling wasn't very good. The shrimp cocktail appetizer came with the prix fixe, and it wasn't big shrimps with cocktail sauce (which is what I was expecting), it was tiny shrimps covered in a mayo-ketchup sauce - not that appetizing.The portion of fish and chips was huge. I had the cod - crispy on the outside, but kind of mushy texture on the inside.For dessert, I had the special tiramisu - not great and I think it should have been colder.They also gave a free shot at the end (vodka, oj, and blue curacao) - yum!Overall, great, friendly service, but the food left something to be desired.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Shrimp cocktail
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Huge portion of fish and chips
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Tiramisu

nmnv-CQZnHWZYuCy0AzFeQ.text: Wow!! The fish is soooo fresh and the service is fantastic. I loved my grilled cod and the Chardonnay. Our server was super friendly and gave us a complimentary appetizer to try. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom

4hahpWf2tB2bqkPUfrd-9g.text: When visiting London you HAVE to try local fish and chips. We were told to try Fish Central and it was quite impressive . Very fresh , simple and tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Ice cream with nectarines and toffee cake , that toffee cake was gooooooood
Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom. Snapper

3MHUCNe3SIshwBvJjAa5Hg.text: Best advice I've ever received from a cabbie. Wonderful food. Splendid service. Perfect portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Central - London, United Kingdom

m3Gkfan9Jya_g1enK3GGRw.text: I am from the west coast of the US where we have tons of seafood. This place beats any seafood place on the west coast of the US. Excellent staff, and the best tasting muscles and clams I've ever had. A must visit.

5AnjWn3gjSbAAID04fEyvw.text: This restaurant was a surprise for us. Tucked away around the corner in a quiet neighborhood. Walking up to the restaurant it doesn't "glow" 5 star.  I am a generous reviewer, but have never given 5 stars.  They earned it.  Hospitality from the moment we walked in to the moments as we were leaving.  "At your elbow" service, not hovering, but anticipating our wants and desires before we knew they were there. Medium to large  menu with , of course good selection of fish, but grilled items as well. The food was cooked to perfection, with a great blend of flavors. Small surprises along the way and a meal closing, palate cleansing, slice of sweet watermelon. All brought joyfully and sometimes seemingly invisibly by a great professional staff.  A great delight.

l6I3WVy1-6y4nUzbtdL4Vw.text: Been here about 3 times. I've always reserved, so I'd recommend that, but it hasn't seemed full to capacity and I've never seen a queue. It's well lit, unpretentious, and at a reasonable price point. Bonus points for fish cakes on the house (more than once I've had this!).Pluses: I like how the focus is on the fish and seafood. The halibut, cod, plaice, skate, are all nicely done. Batter crispy, and at least one of my friends couldn't get enough of it. I do find that, usually about halfway through, the oil tends to overwhelm me (though maybe I'm not cut out for fish and chips). This is a good place to take others who want to try "London fish and chips".

HRiSqRUrE9K-lJR_Jecucg.text: Very good fish and chips plus fish specials. Lobster delicious and not west end prices. Service friendly and in one case unorthodox, but fun

n1e5HynQFGTo8RAVkU3pHA.text: fantastic food, fantastic dining experience and best value for money in London.Definitely the best batter fried fish in london, onion rings and chips are also fantastic.Service is great, they always give a complimentary starter and they pace the food just right - long enough for a nice meal but short enough to keep you eating.Fish portions are HUGE. great value and taste!They also do a fantastic job of accommodating large (20+) groups

u-OUABPSziF9f8hZ_hnVzA.text: This place was recommended by some locals we met and we were not disappointed. The servers were very friendly and it seemed like there were a lot of regular customers.  The fish and chips were excellent - we had the haddock with matzo meal which was a nice change from the usual fried cod.  For starters we shared the grilled sardines which was very tasty. At the end of the meal the server offered us a digestive which was a nice touch.  Would come back here again the next time we're in the mood for fish n chips.
